question: Question_09_(c)
statement:
Consider the matrix

$A = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 1& 2 & 3 \\ 
0 & 2& 1 & 3\\ 
0 & 3& 0 & 3\\ 

\end{bmatrix}$

c) Find the coordinate vector of $\begin{bmatrix}
0\\ 
1\\ 
2
\end{bmatrix}$ relative to the basis of $\text{Col}(A)$ which you found
in part b
sols:
To find the coordinate vector of $\begin{bmatrix}
0\\ 
1\\ 
2
\end{bmatrix}$relative to the basis of $Col(A)$, we place the basis for
$Col(A)$ and the coordinate vector in an augmented matrix

$\left.\begin{matrix}
2 & 1 & \\ 
1 & 2 & \\ 
0& 3 & 
\end{matrix}\right|\begin{matrix}
0\\ 
1\\ 
2
\end{matrix}$

R1-R2 R2-R1 R3-R2 R2 divided by 3 R1+R2

$\left.\begin{matrix}
1 & 0 & \\ 
0 & 1 & \\ 
0& 0 & 
\end{matrix}\right|\begin{matrix}
-1/3\\ 
2/3\\ 
0
\end{matrix}$

so we have x1 = -1/3 x2 = 2/3

Thus, the coordinate vecctor of $\begin{bmatrix}
0\\ 
1\\ 
2
\end{bmatrix}$ relative to basis of $Col(A)$ is $\binom{-1/3}{2/3}$
